resources.string: This is the pin value that controls the lantern light.
This is the minimum brightness that the lantern can be set to. NOTE: Due to how the heuristics on the light work, a lower min brightness will cause the light to dim quicker. (Default: 250)
This is the maximum brightness that the lantern can be set to. NOTE: Any value about ~550 appears to have no noticeable difference with regards to brightness. (Default: 450)
This value controls how smoothly the light ramps up and down. Higher values will make the light level ramp faster. (Default: 1)
This value controls the delay in between each interval in the light\'s flicker routine. NOTE: A higher value will produce a slower flicker. (Default: 1)
This value controls the time in between dropping from the highest value to the minimum value for any given flicker interval. (Default: 150)

This value controls how much the light level drops after hitting the max value for any given flicker interval. A higher value will increased the perceived \"flicker\" for that given interval. (Default: 2)
This is the name of the lantern. Give it a unique name so that you can differentiate it from the rest!
